head.title: A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. - Page #19

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #19 of 50 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Wentzel, Willard Ferdinand. A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0022

div.p: Monday 1st[.] Dispatched Gibeau & The Father of F-t-es for Mr Keith with letters – before sun rise[.] Fine weather[.]

Tuesy 2nd[.] Our Hunters brought us 23 Hares[.] [T]hey have taken up their Snares to put them elsewhere as they can take no more upon their old road[.] Beaulieu & Sutherd went to Trench a Br Lodge opposite to the Fort on the other side of the Grand River[.] Very Cold weather[.]

Wednesy 3rd[.] In the Evening Croup de Chien Came with 7 Skins furrs & 2 Beavers in meat – which he had Killed while the other Hunters has supposed and reported here that he was Sick[.] The Boys took 15 Hares to day[.] Cold extreme[.]

Thursy 4th[.] In the afternoon one of the Hunters having forgot his Knife yesterday came to day with 10 Hares & went away immediately with old Croup de Chien to Hunt hares also[.] Beaulieu & Sutherland have Trenched again but could Kill nothing – the little morass being full of Stones[.]

Friday 5th[.] Bealieu busily employed at his Beaver Lodge with various success – missing at times & stabbing at others with out Killing anything[.] Snow at Intervals[.] Sutherd took 11 Hares in Baulieu's Snares[.]

Satur y 6th[.] Beaulieu ran his Trench through the body of the Beaver but was not Strong enough to Keep his hold – so that the Beast escaped again[.] In the evening Levrier & Byr arrived there brought 19½ Skins in Beaver & 2 in meat besides 60 Hares[.] Gave them a Dram & bit Tobo[.] Cold weather[.]

Sunday 7th[.] The Indians who arrived yesterday having paid their debts – Traded 7½ Skins of Furrs[.] Gave them agreeable to demand Trenches files & Axes – to the Amounts of 16 Skins on Credit again[.] For they are going to Hunt Beaver & to continue it untill the Spring[.] If his lordship choses I am certain that he will not be the most indolent of those who will come at that season – for he has pride enough & is moreover one of the Young Moguls of the Place – being the indisputable Heir of the Great Chief – A place to which he aspires[.] Beaulieux made another fruitless effort to Kill his Beaver[.] Fine weather[.] [W]hen I say fine weather – I only mean that the Sun Shines[.]

Monday 8th[.] Late in the evening last, Cadien le Gros Ney's Brother with Cadien le Sapin – Gibeau & The Farting Father arrived – the two Former with letters – having met the Latters above L'Ile du Gros Cap

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
